turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: We've crossed the threshold.  You want to call it off?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: If you could fight anyone... one on one, whoever you wanted, who would you fight?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: My boss, probably.  Who would you fight?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Oh, yeah.  I didn't know my dad.  Well, I knew him, till I was six.  He went and married another woman, had more kids. Every six years or so he'd do it again -- new city, new family.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: He was setting up franchises.  My father never went to college, so it was really important that I go.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: After I graduated, I called him long distance and asked, "Now what?"  He said, "Get a job."  When I turned twenty-five, I called him and asked, "Now what?"  He said, "I don't know. Get married."

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: A generation of men raised by women. I'm wondering if another woman is the answer we really need.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't know how Tyler found the house, but he'd been there for half a year.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The previous occupant had been a bit of a shut-in.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Oh, a new riot control grenade...  "...the successful combination of concussive, 3000 foot-candle flash- blasts and simultaneous high-velocity disbursement of...blah, blah, blah..."

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: "I am Joe's Lungs."  It's written in first person.  "Without me, Joe could not take in oxygen to feed his red blood cells."  There's a whole series -- "I am Joe's Prostate."

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: "I get cancer, and I kill Joe."

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Soldier of Fortune.  Business Week. New Republic.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: A guy came to fight club for the first time, his ass was a wad of cookie dough.  After a few weeks, he was carved out of wood.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: If you could fight any celebrity?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Fight club became the reason to cut your hair short and trim your fingernails.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Abe Lincoln.  Big reach.  Skinny guys fight till they're burger.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: He was obviously able to handle it.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: I mean, this girl... uh, you're not into her or anything... ?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Good.  This chick was up on the table with her legs in the stirrups before the doctor even walked in the room. The things that she said... I've never heard a woman talk like that...

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: She is a wild, twisted bitch.  Stay away from that one.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Oh, and my pace is more librarians.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Marla doesn't need a lover.  She needs a case worker.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: She needs an exorcist.  This isn't love.  This is sport-fucking.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: She'd invaded my support groups, now she's invading my home.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Listen... do me a favor... sit here a minute...

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: You've gotta understand something about me.  I have a little rule, okay?  Don't ever talk to her about me.  Ever.  I can't stand that kind of shit.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: If you ever say anything about me or about what happens here in this house, to her or anyone -- I will find out.  And you'll never see me again.  Promise me.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: That was three times you promised.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: You want to finish her off?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: "The liberator who destroyed my property has re-aligned my paradigm of perception."

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Shhhhhh!  I don't know what to make of this, sir, I really don't...

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: As the fat renders, the tallow floats to the surface.  Remember the crap they taught you in Boy Scouts.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hard to imagine you in Boy Scouts.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: This clear layer in glycerin.  We'll mix it back in when we make the soap.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Tyler's kiss was a bonfire on the back of my hand.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Guided meditation worked for cancer, it could work for this.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Stop it.  This is your pain -- your burning hand.  It's right here.  Look at it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I was going to my cave to find my power animal.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I... I think I understand.  I think I get it...

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: No, what you're feeling is premature enlightenment.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: This is the greatest moment of your life and you're off somewhere, missing it.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Shut up.  Our fathers were our models for God.  And, if our fathers bailed, what does that tell us about God?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Listen to me.  You have to consider the possibility that God doesn't like you, he never wanted you.  In all probability, He hates you.  This is not the worst thing that can happen...

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Fuck damnation.  Fuck redemption.  We are God's unwanted children, with no special place and no special attention, and so be it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Six months advance pay.  Six months!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: There's fight club in Delaware City.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Local 8 just started in Penns Grove. And, Bob said he was at fight club in Newcastle last week.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Newcastle?  Did you start that one?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: An expired community college student ID card.  What did you used to study, Raymond K. Hessel?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: I asked you what you studied.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I felt like destroying something beautiful.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Why wasn't I told about "Project Mayhem?"

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: What should I have told you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Why wasn't I involved from the beginning?  You and I started fight club together.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Fight club was the beginning.  Now it's out of the basements and there's a name for it -- Project Mayhem.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Is this a needlepoint club?  Is it about you and me?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: What do you want?  A statement of purpose... ?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Should I E-mail you?  Should I put this on your "action item list?"

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: What do you want to know about Project Mayhem?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: This does not belong to us.  We are not the leaders.  We are not special.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: We are the all-singing, all-dancing crap of the world.  We are all part of the same compost heap...

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: You choose your level of involvement. I won't make decisions for you.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: You're asking questions that don't have answers.  You know just as much about Project Mayhem as anybody else.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: If you died right now, how would you feel about your life?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I would feel nothing about my life? Is that what you want to hear?!

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: I want to hear the truth.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Fuck my life.  Fuck fight club.  Fuck you and fuck Marla.  I'm sick of this.  How's that?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Why do you think I blew up your condo?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Hitting bottom isn't a weekend retreat!  It's not a seminar!  You have to forget everything you know, everything you think you know -- about life, about friendship, about you and me.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: If the applicant is young, we tell him he's too young.  Old, too old. Fat, too fat.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: If the applicant waits at the door for three days without food, shelter or encouragement, then he can enter and begin training.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: And, we're definitely filling a void in the rural South.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Why do people think I'm you?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: You broke your promise.  You talked to her about me.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Why do people think I'm Tyler Durden?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: People think that you're me, because you and I happen to share the same body.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Is this really news to you?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Sometimes I control it, and you imagine yourself watching me...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The first rule of fight club is -- you don't talk about fight club.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: He's not here!  Tyler's not here anymore!  He's gone away!

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: You can see me and hear me, but no one else can...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Oh, yeah.  I didn't really know my Dad...

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: But, when you fall asleep, I do things without you...

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: There!  Happy?  I asked for one thing from you... one simple promise.  Now look what you've done!

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: We're going to have to do something about Marla...

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: It's okay.  We okay... a little codependent, sure, but...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No!  This isn't true.  We... we were around other people, together, both of us...

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: You never talked to me in front of anyone else.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Wrong, wrong -- what about the car crash... the two guys in the backseat?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You took me to the house.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: The house is rented in your name.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Night jobs -- while you were sleeping.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: You could be standing under 37 stories of steel and concrete with a 150 gallons of nitroglycerin strapped to the support... oh, maybe it couldn't be...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You... you can't be serious about this.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: What a ridiculous thing to say.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: ...go through with this? What are you going to do?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: ...your sentences!  They're our sentences.  Get your mind around that.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: What are you doing running through the streets in your underpants?  We both use that body.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Since when is Project Mayhem about murder?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: The buildings were evacuated thirty minutes ago.  Everything's proceeding exactly as planned.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You don't know that.  There could still be people inside.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: I wouldn't be doing that.  Unless you know which wires, in what order...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: If I'm wrong, we're both dead..

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Don't pull the green wire.  Pull anything but the green wire.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: I'm serious.  That's the wrong one.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: I've got everything.  The bombs.  The army.  I've got Marla.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Bob is dead, Tyler.  The police blew a hole in his head.  Was that part of your plan?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Bob was a grown man.  In any great struggle, there will be casualties. Wouldn't that be implicit in the name?  Project "Mayhem."

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Fuck your struggle.  I want out.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Not an option, for the most obvious of reasons.  You need to get with the program.  Seven minutes.  Let's get out of here.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I think this is about where we came in.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: This is the beginning.  We're at ground zero.  Maybe you should say a few words, to mark the occasion.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: It's out of our hands.  This is it.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Fifteen seconds now.  Can you see alright?  10... 9... 8....

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Paraffin.  Your merry band mixed the nitro with paraffin.  I saw it floating in the bomb.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Do we have to do everything ourselves?!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: How'd you do that?!  You're a fucking figment of my imagination... you're psychogenic fugue state...

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Fuck that, maybe you're my hallucination.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Why can't I get rid of you?  Why can't I just wish you away?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No, no, I don't.  I thank you, I really do.  Thank you, but I don't need you anymore.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Look, I can be selfish, I know that.  I'm not blind to my own failings...

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: From now on, we'll share Marla. We've been spending too much time apart...

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: No more running off without you. From here on out, we do it together.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Please understand... I've gotten all I can from this, Tyler.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: If I leave, you will be right back where I found you...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I swear on my life, I won't...

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: You will.  You know you will.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What have you left for me?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Why do you want to do that? Why do you want to put that gun in your mouth?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Why are you going with this, Ikea- boy?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's the only way to get rid of you...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Listen, something is going to happen, something terrible...

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Don't worry about us, sir.  We're solid.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Now wait, there's been a mix-up. Everything's changed...

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: You told me you'd say that.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: You told me you'd say that, too.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Did I tell you I'd call you a fascist dickhead?!

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Well, sir, you said you might.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: It's what he would have wanted, sir.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What he wanted?  Look... look at him. Look at him!  What does he want?  This is a person.  This is not a cog in your machine...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No, no.  This is a man -- this man has a name...

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: But, in Project Mayhem, we have no names.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No!  Wrong!  This man's name is Robert Paulson.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Robert Paulson is dead.  He's dead, because of you...

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Who told you motherfuckers you could use my place?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: We have a deal worked out with Irvine.

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Irvine?  Irvine's at home with a broken collarbone.

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: He don't own this place, I do.  How much money's he getting for this?

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Look, stupid fuck, I want everyone outta here now!

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: You're welcome to join our club.

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Did you hear what I just said?!

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Okay!  Okay, fuck it!  Use the basement!  Get off me!

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: We need some towels, Lou.  We need replacement light bulbs.

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Alright, Christ!  Fucking let me go!

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Raymond K. Hessel. 1320 SE Benning, apartment A.  A small, cramped basement apartment.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: They give basement apartments letters instead of numbers.  Raymond, you're going to die.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Is this a picture of Mom and Dad?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Your mom and dad will have to call kindly doctor so-and-so to dig up your dental records, because there won't be much left of your face.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: What did you want to be, Raymond K. Hessel?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Stuff.  That means you have to get more schooling.

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: Kimberly Burroughs, eh?  What do you want?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: I thought...I thought you might be able to help me.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: I had a premonition about the Route 18 pile up... I saved some people. And now I think Death is after me.

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: Nice work.  Maybe if you're real lucky, you'll wind up in here with me.  But I doubt you'll survive that long.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: It's not just about me.  Someone I saved died last night in a freak accident.  What if the others are in danger, too?

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: Well, if you put them on the list, they're already tits up.

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: Death's list.  The precise order you're going to die in.

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: The survivors of Flight 180 died in the exact order they were originally meant to die in the plane crash. That was Death's original design.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Exact order?  Then I'm next!  I was meant to die with my friends, so I'm next!

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Officer Burke pulled me away from the crash that killed my friends.

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: Congratufuckinglations.  That makes you last to go.  But don't worry, once the others are dead, it'll come back for you.  Always does.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: That still doesn't make sense.  You said you die in the same order you were originally meant to.  But Evan Shaeffer died last in my premonition, not first.

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: That's good.  Get all your tears out now, you'll need your eyes.  For the signs.

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: If you have the same power as Alex, you'll be seeing signs soon.  When you see anything creepy or ominous, an in-your-face irony kinda thing? Don't ignore it.  It usually means the difference between life and death.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: The songs on the radio.  But wait.  I don't understand.  Why is this even happening to me?

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: That's what Alex used to ask himself right up until...

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: I didn't beat it; I hid from it. If you were smart you'd put a down payment on a burial plot and say goodbye to the dog, because what little life you have left is over as you know it.  Don't make new friends, don't fall in love, and don't ever bother trying to save others.  That's the worst killer of them all.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: How can you say that?  What kind of monster are you?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: The second one just dies.  A 16 year old kid.

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: I hope you're ready for this.

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: You have to tell us now.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: I was driving a white van.  It must've gone out of control because it crashed into a lake and I drowned.  It was...horrible.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: I can practically taste the water in my throat.  And something else.  The smell of flowers...

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: Then it wasn't just a sign. It was a premonition?
